review_blob: Bottle....smells like chocolate and raspberry. ..not much for pretzel. Very dark brown not much head. Watery, didnt expect that. Its got a zingy effervescence to it. Not a crunch of pretzel in this...maybe it would be good with pretzels? Anyway the raspberry and chocolate are nice. No big whoop.
beer_name: Rogue Voodoo Doughnut Pretzel, Raspberry, and Chocolate Ale

review_blob: Bottle...Pours cloudy pink...cranberry juice meets iced tea....fluffy pink head that doesnt hang around...it has a nice sour right on the front, but again with the nasty/funky aftertaste that I experienced with the key lime Lambic....its watery and the grape presence is mild through out...although it does go well with spicy mayo

Bottle...Pours pale cloudy yellow, similar to lemoncello. A fluffy head that shies away quickly after the pour...a very tangy/tartness to the whole thing....sour aroma and flavor blended with the lime...but it has a funky aftertaste...not my favorite, but a good concept
12 oz bottle....golden color...aroma is apples and sour cherry...tastes like a sweet tart. ...the cherry is fake and the apples are faint
12 oz bottle...pours an amber color small off white head...slightly sour aroma, yet clean.....the palate is thin/watery apple flavor....by the aroma I expected more

Rating from March 2014....Cloudy copper with a tan head....Malts a mild but packed with a little pop of bitter.....its mellow, mild and has a bit of a creamy body....easy to drink and just nice--like the pic on the bottle....a nice after hike or camping brew

Rating from March 2014....Amber on the pour with a skimming of a tan head....honey honey honey!....oh dear that smells sweet.....the palate is a burst of malt mixed with honey and tainted with molasses(faint) at first .....really tasty--a linger of honey on the finish, which is very clean--not a heavy beer for the amount of scent and taste....a little caramel and a sour fruit (faint) finish

Rating from March 2014...Straw color...off white head....pretty basic looking for a wheat.....a nice whiff of apricot and dried apricots.....sweet flavor up front, this almost seems like a fruit beer, then its wheat.....some zing mid-palate....its good --goes down easy, would be nice with some sunshine!

Rating from June 2011....Pours a deep orange with a flat head...smells boozy and sweet....can defiantly detect the age here....its mellow---nothing special , but a good trippel...I forget how old it actually is...I think its been in the rack a year and a half....a little metal on the sniff

Rating from June 2011....12 oz. bottle...pours a rich dark brown color with a small off white head...rich chocolate malty aroma ...sweet and hearty....any honey is subtle....coffee and chocolate are not....nice effervescence, yet still silky....nice light roasted easy to drink flavor
Rating from 4/2/2011---Rich brown/black color...tastes rich yet light....sweet and toasty---its nice, I get the raspberry ...interesting effervescence

Rating from 11/22/2010.....Red amber color with some off white beige foam....looks real good in the glass....sweet malt cherries and some alcohol on the sniff...I get honey too...Refreshing yet solid--Light bready rye taste mingled with a distinct bitterness and alcohol burst--the honey and cherries dont show up as strong as in the aroma for sure--the bitterness is overpowering in the finish---as it sits a nice bright tart fruit comes through like a cherry/cranberry with orange as well--good, but I need to age one and return to it

Rating from 11/20/2010....The cork popped...hee hee....Very dark brown to black in color....small brown head.....Belgian yeast and cocoa on the nose....creamy yet effervescent....not very familiar with the Belgian imperial stout as much as the north American styles.....so its difficult for me to say its true to the style.....anyway it takes a while for any of the chocolate flavors to show up....it was harsh at first but mellows out nicely with a bitter finish....liquid velvet for sure after 30 minutes

Rating from 11/20/2010......Black --very little brown sugar colored foam.....1st sniff sweet dark chocolate....flavor is chocolate & a little toffee and coffee...its sweet and hearty at the same time....really nice coffee and lingering chocolate on the finish....excellent balance throughout

Rating from October 2010....Dark as used motor oil with an added swirl of tan--dark tan.....super rich coffee malty aroma...very lacy--taste is incredibly rich with a milk stout quality to it--sugarish richness with a splash of heavy cream and chocolate & coffee....wow...a power bomb of a beer---super creamy on the palate and just an overall yum for a cream stout--dessert

Rating from October 2010....Smells like a stank ass barnyard upon opening...pale golden color (piss??)....off white head...oh my.....yeah so it sat for a minute with the same pungent stank....way to stay true to the style DFH...bitter stinky flavor sharp and foul just not the brew for me...sadly I just dont like this style very much
beer_name: Dogfish Head / Victory / Stone Saison du BUFF

review_blob: Rating from September 2010....Its brown with a tan colored head....not much aroma....birch beer flavor...weird but true....muddled malts and hops play into this mix....its just ok for me

Rating from 9/20/2010....Sweet malty aroma with a touch of butterscotch...light copper color...flavor is totally different than aroma...its crazy smoked, like a burnt hot dog...its not great....and thats it...very simple

Rating from September 2010....Dark as night without moon....rich roasted malt with chocolate baking cocoa....wow...dark ass malt...coffee for certain...bakers cocoa/dark chocolate....shines strongly and lingers on the palate....the licorice is subtle to my taste...but I do get it....not a licorice fan, but presented in this beer, its ok by me--bitter finish--goes down easy for 11%....just good!...well crafted and quite an experience for my senses

Rating from 8-28-2010.....Bottle....Pours very dark brown...medium brown carbonated head....thick rich body....dark slightly bitter malt--sweet up front on the first sip....aroma some brown sugar/dark malts (roasted)....a little cocoa throughout aroma and palate---I get the essence of oak. But Im sure its the birch (never had birch in this way, only in soda).....the maple is present but subtle---thanks Wayne....It got better and better the more that I sipped
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Dogfish Head Life & Limb

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Rating from July 2010...Amber colored...first sniff is yuengling...in other words a general lager aroma with a fruity citrus finesse....taste is better than aroma.....a kicked up spiced up lager...it is good though....nice balance....slightly above average.....grapefruit hints throughout and the bitterness of the flavor is in the finish...nice even body

Rating from July 2010....Its brown in color by the lantern....***Jen smells sweet creamed corn??***.....caramel aroma--sweet light malty scents in the nostrils....bubbly body with a medium malt flavor mixed with spices and a burnt caramel with a nutty touch

Rating from 7-30-2010....Its a campground rating by lantern light...wow havent rated a beer in ages!...well months...quite cloudy peachy orange in color.....sweet floral aroma filled with coriander....creamy mouth feel with lemon and orange bursts-sweet--it has a cereal grain backbone...slight bitter in the finish....very good and the alcohol is well hidden ....good amount of sediment as well
beer_name: Long Trail Brewmaster Series Winter White

review_blob: Rating from May 2010....its pale golden with an off white head....a very simple aroma...very lager-like...simple flavor as well...an easy to drink wheat....nothing special....nothing offense--a little citrus action happening in the finish

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Rating from 4-20-2010....12 oz. bottle...copper with a beige head....the aroma is so light its almost non-existent...a whiff of malt and a whiff of citrus & some metal :(...there is not much to this beer, the closest to hops I get are in the mild bitter finish...there is a lot of metallic flavor throughout this beer....and its watery

Rating from 4/6/2010...It pours a nice clean copper with a tan head...light malt aroma and a sweet citrus whiff....the taste is very similar to the aroma...its light bodied but with a touch of creaminess...not bad...not bad at all

Rating from 4/6/2010.....Amber body with a beige head...in your face aroma of fresh hops & malt ...the hops smell almost 100% fresh out of the sealed bag (homebrew kit)....creamy palate filled with hops---but not heavy and bitter, more of a delicate balance of hop and malt....the only bitter hops I get are in the finish....mild and mellow, and well made----even the grapefruit and orange flavors are delicate, yet in your face
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: Rating from 3-28-2010....lets just say its black....dark brown sugar colored head....super creamy body....nice roasted malt/milky chocolate aroma....a little coffee taste and aroma...quite the tasty milk/sweet stout!

Rating from 3-28-2010....Pours light to medium brown...small beige head....aroma is sugar and malt...very strong on the sugar...flavor is sugar also mixed with malt and spices....brown sugar and a prune/raisin taste...no complexity to it...yet also not offensive.....as it warms up, I get a little clove/banana action in the mouth
beer_name: River Horse Belgian Freeze Winter Ale

review_blob: Rating from 3-22-2010...Medium brown color...it smells like the coca cola syrup Mama used to give me with an upset belly "did you put it in your mouth?"....licorice in my mouth along with a bready malt...its intriguing, verging on weird....a little over carbonated and bitter finish
beer_name: Jolly Pumpkin / Ngne  / Stone Collababeire Special Holiday Ale

review_blob: Rating from 3-22-2010...it exploded all over the floor and sink "how do you describe that smell??"....cloudy light copper ..no head...think it landed all on the floor....tastes like bitter dirty pennies (or at least how they smell)....the palate...who cares...well at least I have an Austrian beer for the book!

750 ml bottle...looks like a ginger ale...pungent apple aroma!...slightly sour on the first few sips....like a cider blended with a Flemish sour ale...reminds me of a champagne with all the bubbles that go right to your head!

Bottle....pungent oak aroma mixed with a sweet candied malt...its dark brown...appears black...oak apparent in the taste as well...the dragon dipped its teat in vanilla and took a nap in an oak barrel after a meal of malt balls!

November 2014...bottle....Interesting color...pinkish rusty....a muddy rose beige foam (not around long)...fresh aroma...clean...very clean flavors as well floral and delightful....hibiscus is something I recognize right off the bat...but its a good thing...bitter citrus rind on the finish...blended well

November 2014....12 oz bottle...pours copper, has a nice malty aroma with a hop zing...a typical pale ale aroma....this beer is balanced perfectly, really good....light bodied but all the more reason to make this a nice session brew....nothing special but good!

2014 bottle...Cloudy copper, on first inspection seems like a normal pale ale, complete with bitter hops, grapefruit....Im not experiencing a lot of heat here but It does compliment Asian food quite well...I may be a bad judge for heat in this beer, as I put a lot of wasabi on my sushi :).....good stuff though...I get the wasabi flavor minus the heat!

12 oz bottle...golden with a small off white head...aroma is of mild hops and a little bit of pear on the swirl...it has a creaminess to the body...bitter tea finish and the rest is pretty simple nice balance of hops and malts...not a ton of pear, which I dont mind!

Draft at Wegmans pub...apparently brewed just for them...amber color...some spice on the nose and tongue...nutmeg...cinnamon on the finish and a mild caramel through out this beer...good for the style
beer_name: Sly Fox Wegmans Pub Sly Ride Winter Lager

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Bottle....I feel a little dirty putting this in a nice beer snifter ...this is a schwarzbier? ...it pours a very dark brown , like flat coca cola...beige head is pretty flat too...it smells quite metallic...I taste some watery molasses and state smoke, a metallic taste throughout with more metal in the finish...metal metal metal lol......rating from 3-8-2010

Bottle...pours cloudy dark straw with a small off white head....sour wheat aroma with some artificial lemon scent, like a kids cereal...taste is similar....except the lemon is almost like a dish detergent smell.....not a good wheat. Oh and its watery too....rating from 3-2-2010

Bottle...pours black w/ a cocoa colored head....*smell* roasted malts-molasses-dark chocolate(bakers).....*flavor* coffee-molasses-toasty roasted malt-touch of brown sugar-dark chocolate-sweet yet hearty-a pretty solid imperial stout-as it sits, I get a little raisin/prune tasty....sticky on the lips...I would drink this again...rating from 3-2-2010
beer_name: Samuel Adams Imperial Series Imperial Stout

review_blob: Bottle....mahogany on the pour...small white foam...and some dots of lacing....citrus aroma(orange)...malts with bready rye thing happening....its an odd combo....im a brown beer fan ...but the hops over power the brown in this one...its an interesting creation and after it opens for a while it improves....where then I taste just hops on the front..then a brown ale finish...sticky on the lips...rating from 3-2-2010

12 oz. bottle-amber to brown body, off white small head-a nice malt aroma-some citrus- favor a little thin but caramel is present-toasty malt finish-a little bready-not bad...not bad at all-rating from 3-1-2010

2006 Bottle Conditioned-Rating from 2-28-2010
Corked bottle-pours dark golden with a little off white foam-yeasty spicy nose with apples-it has a nice body to it-light with a touch of creaminess-spicy fruits in the flavor with a hint of clove and banana-it has an excellent candi sugar sweetness on the finish-the finish is actually the best part, some apples show up there too-as it opens, I get some peaches and a little cinnamon mixed in there....it aged well!

Corked 750 ml that foamed up like a wild devil upon opening and pouring...the foam is as thick as the snow drifts outside...except this is dirty snow atop a medium brown body with some copper highlights.....light floral hop aroma and some added sour funk.....light piney and citrus hop flavor with pineapples as well ...its different, light and easy to drink...it grows on me the more I sip
-rating from 2-10-2010

-12 oz. bottle
-pours pale copper, light tan head
-now this is an IPA aroma!
-sweet hop flowers drenched in a malted hug
-a creamy mouth feel
-bitter citrus that that through the entire sip ends up in the finish
-the citrus is good and the beer is good :)
-rating from 2-9-2010

-12 oz. bottle
-cloudy light copper w/ a fluffy light beige head
-light hoppy aroma and taste
-
-a little malt backbone, but not enough to make this a great IPA
-its a watered down orange driven IPA that finishes without a fight
-perhaps a bad bottle?
-rating from 2-9-2010
beer_name: Michigan Brewing High Seas India Pale Ale

review_blob:
12 oz bottle....yellow/straw w/ a small off white head....
-smells like a lager
-up front sour matiness
-nothing to it
-let me rephrase...nothing great to it
-I dont think Im a lager fan ...this beer was a reminder of that
-its not the worst lager Ive ever had...but wouldnt buy again (unless they change the recipe)
-I had to drink it quickly because I didnt care for the aftertaste of sour
-rating from 2-9-2010

Sept 2014-12oz bottle....cloudy copper with an off white head...it smells sweet and floral with a mild hop /malt profile...nice body...clean flavor with a mild bitterness...nothing to really wow here, a nice sipper with a mild citrus bite

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Sept 2014-12oz bottle...Amber...smells mainly of apples and faint pumpkin spice....the pumpkin flavor is very mild in the flavor as well...very decent fall brew....refreshing and sweet (but not overly sweet)...its like fall in a glass :)
